waypoints.note: Acclimatisation hike from Manang. Glacial lake with 360° views.

Lago Dickson shore. Remote north section. 400m.
Lenga beech forest before the pass. 400m.

Main hub on Lago Pehoé with ferry connection. 150m.

itinerary.route: Chileno to Mirador Base Torres & Exit

waypoints.note: O Circuit highpoint. First view of Grey Glacier from summit.

waypoints.note: Valle del Francés hanging glaciers and cascading waterfalls.

waypoints.name: Paine Grande
waypoints.note: Highest peak in the massif. Visible from Grey and Paine Grande hut.

waypoints.name: Lago Nordenskjöld
waypoints.note: Turquoise lake stretching beneath the Cuernos. Wind-whipped.

Swiss Val Ferret village. Entering Switzerland. 1594m.

Remote Swiss village below Glacier du Trient. 1279m.
Chamonix valley village below Argentière Glacier. 1252m.
Circuit finish. Same as start. 1004m.

waypoints.name: Mont Blanc Summit
waypoints.note: Highest peak in Western Europe. Visible throughout the circuit.

waypoints.name: Col de la Seigne

waypoints.name: Col du Bonhomme
waypoints.note: Classic Day 2 col. Gateway to Les Chapieux. Often windy.

waypoints.note: Italy–Switzerland border. Enters Swiss Val Ferret valley.

waypoints.name: Aiguille du Midi
waypoints.note: Chamonix cable car summit. Overlooks the full circuit from above.

Highest refuge on route, cable car access. 2752m — route highpoint.

In the Civetta group. Wild and remote. 1714m.
Last rifugio. Descent to Agordo / Belluno valley. 1834m.

waypoints.name: Lago di Braies

waypoints.name: Cinque Torri
waypoints.note: Five iconic towers. WWI open-air museum with original trenches.

waypoints.name: Civetta North Face
waypoints.note: One of the great Alpine north walls. Seen from Coldai hut.

waypoints.name: Marmolada Glacier
waypoints.note: Highest Dolomite glacier. Visible from Coldai/Viel dal Pan area.

waypoints.name: Croda da Lago
waypoints.note: Beautiful lake below the crags. Città di Fiume area.

Shira plateau moorland. Open volcanic landscape. 3840m.

waypoints.name: Lava Tower
waypoints.note: Acclimatisation lunch stop. 'Climb high sleep low' turning point.

waypoints.note: Whiskey Route trailhead. Park registration. Rainforest entry.

itinerary.route: Happy Isles to Little Yosemite Valley
itinerary.mapNote: First camp. Merced River canyon. 1830m.

itinerary.route: LYV to Sunrise High Sierra Camp
itinerary.mapNote: Historic Sierra Club camp at granite basin. 2933m.
Largest subalpine meadow in Sierra. Store + PO resupply. 2621m.
Flat meadow camp along Lyell Fork. 2960m.
Iconic lake below Banner Peak. 2928m.

itinerary.route: Thousand Island Lake to Reds Meadow
itinerary.mapNote: Hot springs, café, resupply. Rainbow Falls nearby. 2278m.
High lake camp in granite basin. 3099m.
Remote granite lake camp. 3301m.

itinerary.mapNote: Resupply point. Ferry across Edison Lake. 2155m.

High lake before Selden Pass. 3332m.

Before Mather Pass 3889m. Broad Kings River headwaters basin. 3534m.

Beautiful chain of lakes below Glen Pass. 3322m.
Below Forester Pass. Bubbs Creek confluence. 3008m.
After Forester Pass 4009m (JMT highpoint). 3569m.
Highpoint of contiguous USA 4421m. Trailhead at Whitney Portal. 2550m.

waypoints.note: Above Rae Lakes. Dramatic Kings Canyon granite.

waypoints.name: Mather Pass
waypoints.note: Steep south-side switchbacks above Upper Basin.

waypoints.note: Yosemite icon. Optional cable route from JMT. Permit required.

waypoints.name: Thousand Island Lake
waypoints.note: Banner Peak reflection. Most photographed lake on the JMT.

waypoints.name: Guitar Lake

itinerary.mapNote: Above the dramatic Routeburn Falls. 1000m.

itinerary.route: Falls Hut to Lake Mackenzie Hut

waypoints.note: Dramatic cascade above the hut. Short detour worth taking.

waypoints.name: Milford Sound
waypoints.note: End destination post-trail. Mitre Peak 1692m. Fiord cruise.

Acclimatisation day. Same teahouses. 3440m.
Famous monastery on ridge. Ama Dablam views. 3867m.
Imja Khola side valley. Great Lhotse views. 4360m.
Acclimatisation day. Same teahouses. 4360m.
Moraine camp below Lobuche Peak. 4940m.

Return to Sherpa capital. Last teahouse comforts. 3440m.
Final overnight before flight. Celebrate at Hillary Bar. 2840m.
Tribhuvan Airport. End of trek. 1400m.

waypoints.name: Everest Base Camp
waypoints.note: South Base Camp on Khumbu Glacier. Icefall and expedition tents.

waypoints.name: Kala Patthar
waypoints.note: Best Everest pre-dawn view. Highest point on standard EBC trek.

waypoints.name: Tengboche Monastery
waypoints.note: Most famous Khumbu monastery. Ama Dablam backdrop.

waypoints.name: Ama Dablam
waypoints.note: The Matterhorn of the Himalaya. Visible for most of the trek.

waypoints.name: Hillary Suspension Bridge
waypoints.note: One of world's highest suspension bridges. Dudh Koshi River.

waypoints.name: Khumbu Glacier
waypoints.note: Enormous glacier flowing from Everest's Western Cwm.

waypoints.name: Everest Summit
waypoints.note: World's highest peak. Visible from Kala Patthar on clear days.

waypoints.name: Namche Bazaar Saturday Market
waypoints.note: Sherpa capital weekly market. Yaks, equipment, food. Don't miss.

itinerary.mapNote: Highest hut. Obsidian (hrafntinna) landscape. Geothermal vents. 1060m.
Swan Lake. Two huts here. Dramatic valley. 570m.
Mælifellssandur black desert crossing. Emstrur gorge views. 490m.
Trail end. Volcano-ringed valley. Bus to Reykjavik. 120m.

waypoints.name: Landmannalaugar
waypoints.note: Trek start. Geothermal hot springs among rhyolite rainbow mountains.

waypoints.name: Bláhnúkur Peak
waypoints.note: Red-striped rhyolite summit. Optional scramble from Hrafntinnusker.

waypoints.name: Hrafntinnusker Obsidian
waypoints.note: Largest obsidian (volcanic glass) field in the world. Jet black.

waypoints.name: Álftavatn (Swan Lake)
waypoints.note: Glacial lake with Tindfjallajökull glacier as backdrop.

waypoints.name: Eyjafjallajökull Volcano
waypoints.note: 2010 eruption shut European airspace. Visible from Þórsmörk finish.

waypoints.name: Þórsmörk (Thor's Forest)
waypoints.note: Trail end. Birch woodland ringed by three glaciers. Bus to Reykjavik.

itinerary.mapNote: First camp. Arrival lake below Jirishanca. 4420m.
Triple-peak reflection lake. Yerupajá, Siula, Jirishanca. 4138m.
Below Siula Grande (scene of 'Touching the Void'). 4350m.
Natural thermal pool camp. Cuyoc Pass 5000m crossed. 4350m.
High pass day. Remote southern circuit section. 4600m.
Only village on circuit. Basic supplies available. 3500m.
High camp before final pass. Wild camping. 4700m.
Final camp. Yerupajá reflected in lake. Exit via Llamac. 4100m.

waypoints.name: Yerupajá
waypoints.note: Second highest in Peru. 'El Carnicero'. Reflected in Carhuacocha.

waypoints.name: Siula Grande
waypoints.note: 'Touching the Void' — Joe Simpson's legendary survival story here.

waypoints.name: Jirishanca
waypoints.note: 'Ice Flower of the Andes'. One of most beautiful Andean peaks.

waypoints.name: Carhuacocha Lake
waypoints.note: Triple-peak reflection lake. Most photographed spot on circuit.

waypoints.name: Cuyoc Pass
waypoints.note: Highest pass on circuit. Often snow-covered even in dry season.

waypoints.name: Jahuacocha Lake
waypoints.note: Final lake. Yerupajá reflection. Circuit's most scenic finish.

waypoints.name: Tapush Pass
waypoints.note: Second 5000m+ pass. Southern section. Often lonely and wild.

itinerary.mapNote: Last village on trail. Filled with eucalyptus & camp. 3000m.
Camp in valley after Dead Woman's Pass 4215m. 3600m.
Beautiful Inca ruin camp. Cloud forest. Last camp. 2650m.
Sunrise at Inti Punku (Sun Gate), then descent to the citadel. 2430m.

waypoints.name: Km 82 Trailhead
waypoints.note: Official trail start. Urubamba River crossing. Permit check.

waypoints.name: Warmiwañusca (Dead Woman's Pass)
waypoints.note: Highest point on trail. Named for profile resembling a supine woman.

waypoints.name: Runkurakay Pass
waypoints.note: Second pass. Circular Inca ruin just below summit.

waypoints.name: Phuyupatamarca
waypoints.note: 'Town Above the Clouds'. Five ceremonial baths. Stunning ruin.

waypoints.name: Wiñay Wayna
waypoints.note: 'Forever Young'. Best-preserved agricultural terraces on trail.

waypoints.name: Inti Punku (Sun Gate)
waypoints.note: First view of Machu Picchu at sunrise. 4am hike from final camp.

waypoints.name: Machu Picchu Citadel
waypoints.note: The Lost City of the Incas. UNESCO. New 7 Wonders of World.

itinerary.route: Calenzana to Ortu di u Piobbu
itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Steep opening. Massive elevation gain straight from sea level. No warm-up.
itinerary.mapNote: First refuge. Steep ascent from Balagne. 1520m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Technical ridge walking and boulders. Views of the Cirque de Bonifatu.
itinerary.mapNote: Suspended footbridge crossing. Lac de la Muvrella nearby. 1270m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Spasimata Bridge (famous suspension bridge). Smooth granite slabs that are slippery when wet.
itinerary.overnight: Hôtel Castel de Vergio / Ascu Stagnu
itinerary.mapNote: Ski station refuge. Monte Cinto massif views. 1422m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: The Roof of Corsica. Crosses Pointe des Éboulis (2,607m). Variant: Summit Monte Cinto (+2h).
itinerary.mapNote: Exposed granite traverse day. Wild bivouac refuge. 1683m.

itinerary.route: Tighjettu to Ciottulu di i Mori
itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Shorter day. Passes the Bergerie de Vallone. Beautiful views of Paglia Orba.
itinerary.mapNote: Remote high refuge in the heart of Corsica. 1991m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Lac de Nino. Wild horses graze around this glacial lake. A long but visually rewarding day.
itinerary.mapNote: Lac de Nino alpine plateau nearby. 1601m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: High ridge walking. Steep climb to Bocca alle Porte with views of Melo and Capitello lakes.
itinerary.mapNote: After spectacular Brèche de Capitello scramble. 1842m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Alpine Variant (ridges) vs. Valley route. The ridge route is spectacular but requires a head for heights.
itinerary.mapNote: Forest refuge before the trail's midpoint town. 1430m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Descent into the forest. Passes the Cascades des Anglais (waterfalls/pools).
itinerary.mapNote: Midpoint. Train station, bar, resupply. 1163m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Entering the South. Gentler forest paths under the canopy of Laricio pines.
itinerary.mapNote: Ski resort refuge. Easier southern terrain begins. 1586m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: High-level contouring. Passes through Bocca di Verde. Views of the eastern coastline.
itinerary.mapNote: High meadow refuge with panoramic views. 1820m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: The Knife Edge. A stunning walk along a narrow, rocky spine. One of the most famous sections.
itinerary.mapNote: Perched refuge on knife-edge ridge. 1750m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Cuscione Plateau. Lush green meadows, wild pigs, and streams. A very different landscape.
itinerary.mapNote: Shepherd huts / gîte in remote valley. 1500m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Crossing Monte Incudine (2,134m), the highest point in the South. Expansive 360° views.
itinerary.mapNote: Pine forest refuge before final mountain section. 1535m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Aiguilles de Bavella. Technical "Alpine Variant" (highly recommended) through granite needles.
itinerary.mapNote: Last refuge before descent to coast. 1055m.

itinerary.highlights&Terrain: The victory lap. Descending through pink granite rock and Mediterranean scrub to the finish.
itinerary.mapNote: Trail end. Bus to Porto-Vecchio. 250m.

waypoints.name: Monte Cinto

waypoints.name: Brèche de Capitello

waypoints.name: Lac de Capitello
waypoints.note: Deep crater lake. Startling turquoise colour.

waypoints.name: Lac de Nino
waypoints.note: Pozzines (wet meadows) plateau. Wild horses graze here.

waypoints.name: Monte Renoso
waypoints.note: Optional summit mid-route. Southern section high point.

waypoints.name: Vizzavona Station
waypoints.note: Midpoint town. Train access. Last real resupply until Conca.

waypoints.name: Aiguilles de Bavella
waypoints.note: Dramatic granite needles near southern section. Iconic skyline.

After highest pass of trek Zaso La 5200m. 3900m.

Lower camp as valley widens. 3200m.

itinerary.route: St. Jean Pied de Port to Roncesvalles

itinerary.mapNote: Templar village. Halfway point of the Camino. 880m.

itinerary.mapNote: Walled medieval town. Approaching León. 799m.

itinerary.mapNote: Cathedral arrival. Pilgrim Mass. Botafumeiro. 260m.

Hut at foot of Tjäktjapasset. 696m.

Final beach camp before steep climb inland. 0m.
Ferry across Gordon River. Port Renfrew trailhead. 0m.

Greenland's second-largest town. Colourful houses. Trail end. 0m.

Sunken Lycian city of Simena visible from boats. 0m.

waypoints.note: Day 3 viewpoint hike. 360° Rockies panorama.

waypoints.name: Wonder Pass

Passo San Pellegrino area. Fassatal valley. 1982m.

Below Cima dei Bureloni. 2278m.

Croce d'Aune pass then descent to Feltre medieval town. 325m.

waypoints.name: Pale di San Martino

waypoints.name: Monte Antelao
waypoints.note: 'King of the Cadore'. Second highest Dolomite peak.

waypoints.name: Lago di Misurina
waypoints.note: Reflection lake with Tre Cime. Most photographed lake view.

waypoints.name: Lago Sorapiss
waypoints.note: Milky turquoise glacial lake. Hidden gem of Cadore.

Grisedale Tarn crossing or Striding Edge option. 150m.

Wild Pennine approach. Market town. 170m.

waypoints.name: Striding Edge

waypoints.name: Nine Standards Rigg
waypoints.note: Ancient cairns on Pennine watershed. Lake District/Yorkshire border.

waypoints.name: Swaledale Valley
waypoints.note: Most beautiful Yorkshire dale. Lead-mine ruins, meadows.

waypoints.name: Robin Hood's Bay
waypoints.note: Finish: North Sea. Boot-dipping tradition. Smugglers coves.

itinerary.mapNote: Lava-field approach to South Crater. 1190m.
Crosses Red Crater 1886m, Emerald Lakes, Blue Lake. 1340m.
Desert Road side. Oldest hut on circuit. 1120m.
Circuit complete. Village with ski lodges. 1130m.

waypoints.name: Red Crater
waypoints.note: Active volcanic crater. Highest point on the crossing.

waypoints.name: Emerald Lakes
waypoints.note: Vivid acid-mineral lakes in old explosion craters.

waypoints.name: Blue Lake (Te Wai Whakaata o te Rangihiroa)
waypoints.note: Sacred Māori lake. Deepest blue. Do not touch the water.

waypoints.name: Mount Ngauruhoe
waypoints.note: 'Mount Doom' from Lord of the Rings. Can be climbed from South Crater.

waypoints.name: Mount Ruapehu
waypoints.note: Highest peak on North Island. Active volcano with crater lake.

waypoints.name: South Crater
waypoints.note: Flat plateau between Mangatepopo Valley and Red Crater.

itinerary.route: Sirimon Gate to Old Moses Camp

waypoints.name: Batian Peak

waypoints.name: Lewis Glacier
waypoints.note: Rapidly retreating equatorial glacier below the peaks.

waypoints.name: Simba Col
waypoints.note: Pre-dawn col approach to Lenana. Spectacular sunrise views.

waypoints.name: Hall Tarns
waypoints.note: Glacial lakes with Batian reflection. Near Shiptons Camp.

waypoints.name: Giant Groundsel Forest
waypoints.note: Otherworldly Afroalpine vegetation. Giant lobelias and groundsels.

itinerary.mapNote: Old-growth forest south side of Rainier. 1310m.
Remote northwest plateau. Lake James. 1640m.
Meadow plateau. Panoramic Rainier views. 1645m.
Largest and deepest lake in park. 1519m.
Carbon River valley. Temperate rainforest. 570m.
Northeast side. Spray Park meadows above. 870m.
East side. Glacier-fed braided river. 1188m.
Remote meadow. Best wildflowers on circuit. 1840m.
Ohanapecosh watershed. Maple forest. 610m.
Historic inn and museum. Circuit complete. 840m.

waypoints.name: Mount Rainier Summit

waypoints.name: Spray Park Meadows
waypoints.note: Best wildflower meadow on circuit. Rainier looming above.

waypoints.name: Carbon Glacier

waypoints.note: Most remote and spectacular camp. Wildflowers and waterfall.

waypoints.note: Closest lake to Fitz Roy. Pre-dawn hike for clear reflections.

waypoints.name: Cerro Torre
waypoints.note: Arguably the world's most difficult rock climb. Ice mushroom summit.

waypoints.name: Laguna Torre
waypoints.note: Glacier and Cerro Torre reflections. Detached iceberg sometimes.

waypoints.name: Piedras Blancas Glacier

waypoints.name: El Chaltén Village

17th century colony ruins. Ferryland Head lighthouse. 30m.
Small outport. Dramatic sea cliffs. 40m.
Capelin Cove viewpoint. 60m.
B&B in old fishing community. 30m.
Abandoned outport resettled. Suspension bridge. 20m.
Remote coastal community. 40m.
Quiet fishing village on isthmus. 20m.
Major whale-watching port. Gannets offshore. 10m.
Picturesque heritage harbour. Near St. John's. 10m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Most Easterly Point in N. America
itinerary.mapNote: Easternmost point of North America. Lighthouse. 80m.
Newfoundland's colourful capital. George Street. 140m.
North of St. John's. Beach community. 20m.
Volcanic rock coastline. Icebergs May–June. 40m.
Final coastal community before Topsail. 30m.
Trail end on Conception Bay. 10m.

waypoints.name: Bay Bulls Puffin Colony

itinerary.mapNote: High mountain hut below Triglav summit. 2401m.

Ad Deir Monastery approach. Nabataean carved city. 900m.

waypoints.name: Ad Deir Monastery
waypoints.note: Larger than the Treasury. 800 steps. Worth the climb.

waypoints.name: Wadi Rum (nearby)
waypoints.note: Desert of the Moon. T.E. Lawrence country. Mars analogue site.

waypoints.name: Dana Biosphere Reserve
waypoints.note: Jordan's largest nature reserve. Trek starting area.

waypoints.name: Little Petra (Siq al-Barid)

itinerary.mapNote: Remote 2-mile beach. Accessible only by trail or sea. 0m.
Return trek. Trail end at road. 0m.

waypoints.name: Hanakāpīʻai Falls
waypoints.note: 300m waterfall 2mi from trail start. Side trip. Day hikers go here.

waypoints.name: Kalalau Valley
waypoints.note: Largest valley on Nā Pali. Ancient Hawaiian agricultural terraces.

waypoints.name: Nā Pali Cliffs
waypoints.note: 3000ft green ridgelines plunging into the Pacific. No road access.

waypoints.name: Kalalau Beach
waypoints.note: Remote 2-mile beach. Freshwater stream. Goats and sea caves.

waypoints.name: Keʻe Beach (Start/End)
waypoints.note: Trailhead. Coral reef snorkelling. Road end of North Shore.

Open creek-bed camp. Red Centre landscape. 650m.
Slot canyon glows orange at midday. 650m.
High ridge camp. 360° views of ranges. 1120m.

Most popular swimming hole on trail. 690m.

Ancient Finke River crossing. 770m.
Red-walled gorge with cold waterhole. 740m.

waypoints.name: Jade Dragon Snow Mountain

waypoints.note: Opposite bank peak. Jade Dragon's 'bride' in local legend.

waypoints.name: Walnut Grove

waypoints.name: Cashapampa Trailhead

River camps. Jungle heat. 300m.
Lost City visit: 1,200 stone steps, 169 terraces. 1100m.
Return to trailhead. 100m.

waypoints.name: Ciudad Perdida

waypoints.name: 1,200 Stone Steps
waypoints.note: Slippery steep approach. Reveals 169 circular terraces at top.

waypoints.name: Buritaca River
waypoints.note: Jungle river crossings on approach. Multiple wade-throughs.

waypoints.name: Mamey Trailhead
waypoints.note: Start/end village. Local Kogi and Wiwa indigenous communities nearby.

waypoints.name: Fuego Eruption Viewpoint
waypoints.note: Ridge between peaks. Close-range lava fountains at night.

waypoints.name: Antigua Guatemala
waypoints.note: Colonial UNESCO city. Trail gateway. Spanish colonial architecture.

waypoints.name: Chairo Village
waypoints.note: Yungas tropical end. Banana and coca plantations.

waypoints.name: Bolivian Cloud Forest
waypoints.note: Extraordinary biodiversity corridor. 4870m → 1300m in 3 days.

Paso Austria and optional peak ascents. Same camp. 4700m.
High traverse between glaciated peaks. 4600m.

itinerary.route: Maria Lloco to Base Huayna Potosi
itinerary.mapNote: Near base of Huayna Potosí 6088m. Road access. 4700m.

waypoints.name: Huayna Potosí

waypoints.name: Paso Austria
waypoints.note: High pass with Cordillera Real panorama. Trek Day 2 highpoint.

waypoints.name: Tuni Lake

waypoints.name: Chearoco Peak
waypoints.note: Highest visible peak from trail. Glaciated massif.

Gorge and oasis descent. 2600m.
Road end. Vehicle to Kelaa des Mgouna. 1600m.

waypoints.name: Tarkeddit Plateau

waypoints.name: Kelaa des Mgouna
waypoints.note: Valley of roses below. Rose festival each May. Trek end.

itinerary.mapNote: Imlil start. Mule path over first pass. 2279m.

Remote Agoundis valley. Berber villages. 1800m.
Highest natural lake in High Atlas. 2313m.
CAF/Club Alpin hut below summit. 3207m.
Pre-dawn Toubkal 4167m summit. Descent to Imlil. 1740m.

waypoints.name: Lac d'Ifni
waypoints.note: Highest natural lake in High Atlas. Remote and beautiful.

waypoints.name: Imlil Village
waypoints.note: Trek gateway. Mule market. Berber guesthouses. Tizi n'Test view.

waypoints.name: Tizi n'Ouanoums
waypoints.note: High pass on approach to Toubkal. Summit plateau edge.

waypoints.name: Toubkal Refuge (CAF)
waypoints.note: Last hut before summit. Crowded in summer. Stunning position.

itinerary.mapNote: Nyakalengija trailhead. Montane forest. 2651m.
Tree heather zone. Giant lobelias and groundsels. 3414m.
Lake Bujuku below Scott Elliot Pass. 3962m.
Glacier approach. Below Stanley Plateau. 4541m.

itinerary.route: Elena to Margherita Peak to Kitandara
itinerary.mapNote: After Margherita Peak 5109m. Kitandara Lakes. 4027m.
Afroalpine moorland. Bog-hopping section. 3261m.
Reverse descent through forest. 2651m.
Trail end. Return to Kasese. 1646m.

waypoints.name: Mount Stanley
waypoints.note: Massif containing Margherita. 'Mountains of the Moon'.

waypoints.name: Lake Bujuku

waypoints.name: Giant Lobelias

waypoints.name: Kitandara Lakes

itinerary.mapNote: Mestia start. Enguri River valley. Medieval towers. 1800m.
Chkhunderi Pass 2741m approach. Remote hamlet. 2050m.
After Chkhunderi Pass. River ford. 1950m.
Europe's highest permanently inhabited settlement. Shkhara base. 2200m.

waypoints.name: Ushguli Village

waypoints.name: Shkhara
waypoints.note: Highest peak in Georgia. Looms above Ushguli village.

waypoints.name: Chkhunderi Pass
waypoints.note: Trek highpoint. River ford on descent. Sometimes snowpack.

waypoints.name: Mestia Town
waypoints.note: Trek start. Svan towers, museum, airport. Gateway to Svaneti.

waypoints.name: Adishi Glacier
waypoints.note: River crossing below glacier. Cold and fast-flowing in summer.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Views of Mt. Ushba (the "Matterhorn" of the Caucasus)
itinerary.mapNote: Mestia start. Enguri valley. 1800m.
Chkhunderi Pass approach. 2050m.
After Chkhunderi Pass 2741m. 1950m.
UNESCO village. Shkhara north face. 2200m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Latpari Pass & views of Shkhara Glacier
itinerary.mapNote: Racha region entry. Remote mountain villages. 1900m.
High pasture traverses. 2100m.
Racha valley villages. Alazan River. 1500m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Rioni River valley & traditional Racha hospitality
itinerary.mapNote: Rioni River source area. 1300m.
Lower Racha. Walnut forests. 1000m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: Final ridge views of the North Wall
itinerary.mapNote: Soviet-era spa resort. Mineral springs. Road access. 1450m.

waypoints.name: Ushguli
waypoints.note: Europe's highest inhabited settlement. Svan towers. Day 4 highlight.

waypoints.name: Shkhara
waypoints.note: Georgia's highest peak. Dominates Ushguli skyline.

waypoints.name: Chkhunderi Pass
waypoints.note: Svaneti traverse highpoint. Day 3 crossing.

waypoints.name: Rioni River Source

waypoints.name: Shovi Mineral Springs

itinerary.mapNote: Drive from Ölgii. Tavan Bogd National Park entry. 2200m.

Malchin Peak 4050m ascent and return. 2700m.
Tsagaan Gol (White River). Glacier meltwater. 2400m.
Black Horse valley. Eagle hunters' territory. 2350m.
Ibex and snow leopard habitat. Remote. 2500m.
Khoton Lake approach. Petroglyphs nearby. 2300m.
Sacred glacial lake. Snow-capped Altai reflections. 2080m.
Kazakh village. Eagle festival area. Trek end. 1900m.

waypoints.name: Malchin Peak

waypoints.name: Khoton Lake

waypoints.name: Five Colour Lake

Geothermal warm springs in canyon. 550m.
Vasbytt = 'hang on tight'. Technical section. 530m.
Wide sandy river bed. Hot exposed walking. 520m.

itinerary.keyHighlight: The first cold beer at the resort
itinerary.mapNote: Geothermal resort. Pool reward after canyon. 490m.

waypoints.name: Fish River Canyon Lookout

waypoints.name: Palm Springs
waypoints.note: Natural thermal springs mid-canyon. Water 60°C. Day 2 highlight.

waypoints.name: Ai-Ais Hot Springs

waypoints.name: Sulphur Springs

waypoints.name: Canyon Main Lookout

itinerary.mapNote: From Timberline Lodge. Sandy River crossing. 1060m.
Ramona Falls passed. McNeil Point vista. 1585m.

waypoints.name: Ramona Falls
waypoints.note: Mossy basalt columnar fall. Most popular waterfall on Hood.

waypoints.name: McNeil Point
waypoints.note: Stone shelter viewpoint. Best north-side Hood panorama.

waypoints.name: Timberline Lodge
waypoints.note: 1937 WPA lodge. 'The Shining' exterior. Year-round skiing above.

waypoints.name: Elliot Glacier
waypoints.note: Largest Hood glacier. Crevassed icefall on north face.

itinerary.mapNote: El Chaltén south. Toro lake and glacier. 450m.

itinerary.route: Laguna Toro to Paso del Viento
itinerary.mapNote: Windy pass with ice-cap views. Southern Patagonia Icefield. 600m.

itinerary.route: Paso del Viento to Paso Huemul
itinerary.mapNote: Huemul Pass. Lake views. 650m.
Lake Viedma shore. Boat or trek back to Chaltén. 200m.

waypoints.name: Southern Patagonian Icefield
waypoints.note: Third largest ice mass on Earth. Paso del Viento viewpoint.

waypoints.name: Paso del Viento
waypoints.note: 'Pass of the Wind'. Icefield views. Often extreme wind gusts.

waypoints.name: Paso Huemul
waypoints.note: Named after South Andean deer (huemul). Lake Viedma views.

waypoints.name: Viedma Glacier
waypoints.note: Calving glacier into Lago Viedma. Visible from Day 1–2.

waypoints.name: Cerro Huemul
waypoints.note: Circuit's namesake peak. Views of both Fitz Roy and Cerro Torre.

itinerary.mapNote: Sembalun trailhead ascent. Savannah and forest. 2800m.
Pre-dawn summit 3726m. Descent to crater lake. 2000m.
Senaru crater rim exit. West descent. 600m.

waypoints.name: Rinjani Summit (Puncak Rinjani)
waypoints.note: 2nd highest volcano in Indonesia. Crater lake Segara Anak below.

waypoints.name: Segara Anak Crater Lake
waypoints.note: Sacred crater lake. Pilgrims come to bathe. Barujari cone inside.

waypoints.name: Barujari Cone
waypoints.note: Active inner cone inside crater. Still erupting periodically.

waypoints.name: Hot Springs (Kokok Putih)
waypoints.note: Natural thermal springs at crater lake edge. Post-summit reward.

waypoints.name: Sembalun Trailhead
waypoints.note: Main eastern trailhead. Savannah and strawberry farms below.

itinerary.mapNote: Karakol Valley entry. Fir forest. 2200m.
Turquoise high-altitude lake. 3532m.
After Ala-Kul Pass 3800m. Hot springs valley. 2500m.
Altyn-Arashan gorge exit. Karakol road. 1800m.

waypoints.name: Ala-Kul Lake
waypoints.note: Intensely turquoise glacial lake. Ringed by snow peaks. Kyrgyzstan icon.

waypoints.name: Ala-Kul Pass
waypoints.note: Trek highpoint. Loose scree descent. Crampons sometimes needed.

waypoints.name: Altyn-Arashan Hot Springs
waypoints.note: Natural thermal pools in flower-filled valley. Best end-of-trek reward.

waypoints.name: Karakol Peak
waypoints.note: Highest peak in Terskey Ala-Too range. Looms over Ala-Kul lake.

waypoints.name: Karakol Town
waypoints.note: Gateway city. Orthodox cathedral, Dungan mosque. Trek base.
